To the chief Musician<S>5329</S> on Neginoth<S>5058</S>, A Psalm<S>4210</S> of David<S>1732</S>. Hear<S>6030</S> me when I call<S>7121</S>, O God<S>430</S> of my righteousness<S>6664</S>: thou hast enlarged<S>7337</S> me when I was in distress<S>6862</S>; have mercy<S>2603</S> upon me, and hear<S>8085</S> my prayer<S>8605</S>. <sup>chief: or, overseer</sup> <sup>have: or, be gracious unto me</sup>
O ye sons<S>1121</S> of men<S>376</S>, how long<S>5704</S> will ye turn my glory<S>3519</S> into shame<S>3639</S>? how long will ye love<S>157</S> vanity<S>7385</S>, and seek<S>1245</S> after leasing<S>3577</S>? Selah<S>5542</S>.
But know<S>3045</S> that the LORD<S>3068</S> hath set apart<S>6395</S> him that is godly<S>2623</S> for himself: the LORD<S>3068</S> will hear<S>8085</S> when I call<S>7121</S> unto him.
Stand in awe<S>7264</S>, and sin<S>2398</S> not: commune<S>559</S> with your own heart<S>3824</S> upon your bed<S>4904</S>, and be still<S>1826</S>. Selah<S>5542</S>.
Offer<S>2076</S> the sacrifices<S>2077</S> of righteousness<S>6664</S>, and put your trust<S>982</S> in the LORD<S>3068</S>.
There be many<S>7227</S> that say<S>559</S>, Who will shew<S>7200</S> us any good<S>2896</S>? LORD<S>3068</S>, lift thou up<S>5375</S> the light<S>216</S> of thy countenance<S>6440</S> upon us.
Thou hast put<S>5414</S> gladness<S>8057</S> in my heart<S>3820</S>, more than in the time<S>6256</S> that their corn<S>1715</S> and their wine<S>8492</S> increased<S>7231</S>.
I will both<S>3162</S> lay me down<S>7901</S> in peace<S>7965</S>, and sleep<S>3462</S>: for thou, LORD<S>3068</S>, only<S>910</S> makest me dwell<S>3427</S> in safety<S>983</S>.
